definition: role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: People wrestle in Delhi for water.
sentences.chinese: 新德里人民上演抢水的角力。

sentences.english: I hold an optimistic view of events.
sentences.chinese: 我看事情角力较量商酌达观。

sentences.english: We still have to wrestle with hangers and clips to hang clothes.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍然要角力与吊杆和剪辑坑的衣服。

sentences.english: The main causes of this are bureaucracy and isometric struggles against competition.
sentences.chinese: 主要的肇因是官僚系统和各种角力对竞争的阻碍。

sentences.english: I know that political campaigns can sometimes seem small, even silly.
sentences.chinese: 我知道政治角力有时会显得小家子气甚至愚蠢。

sentences.english: And the same holds in boxing and in the pancratium?
sentences.chinese: 在拳击和角力中不也是这样吗？

definition: to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter/fierce rivalry/tug-of-war
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
lit. short-weaponed soldiery fight one another (idiom); fierce hand-to-hand infantry combat/to fight at close quarters
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
